title: Dual Audio-Centric Modality Coupling for Talking Head Generation
author: Ao Fu (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Southeast University, China), Ziqi Ni (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Southeast University, China), Yi Zhou (School of Computer Science and Engineering, Southeast University, China), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a framework for generating audio-driven talking head videos, which could enhance Haohe Liu's work in text-to-audio generation and audio manipulation by applying similar principles to audio-visual synchronization tasks.
background: This research focuses on using audio inputs to create realistic 3D facial animations, including lip synchronization and dynamic facial expressions.
contribution: This paper introduces the Dual Audio-Centric Modality Coupling (DAMC) framework to solve the challenge of audio-visual synchronization in talking head generation, achieving improved lip synchronization and visual quality compared to existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled to effectively capture the relationship between audio features and facial dynamics, often resulting in poor lip synchronization and image quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work incorporates a dual encoder structure that separately captures content and dynamic features from audio inputs, improving the integration of these features for more accurate synthesization.

key_innovation: The integration of two distinct audio feature extractors to enhance synchronization and quality in talking head generation.
real_world_impact: The framework provides significant advancements for applications in virtual avatars and digital media, demonstrating potential for enhanced user experience in interactive technologies.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention any limitations.

new_terms.Dual Audio-Centric Modality Coupling: A novel framework that combines complementary audio features to improve the synthesis of talking head videos.
new_terms.Content-Aware Encoder: An audio encoder focused on capturing the semantic content of speech.
new_terms.Dynamic-Sync Encoder: An audio encoder designed specifically for ensuring visual synchronization with facial movements.
